description: Changes the surface of a material—like adding a special coating—to make it harder, smoother, or more resistant to rust.

description: Develops and tests new materials, like stronger plastics or lighter metals. They help other engineers figure out which material is best for building a specific product.

description: Designs devices that use both light and electricity, like the LEDs in your TV or the solar cells on your roof.

description: Builds software for the rugged hand-held scanners and tablets used in warehouses or factories. The software must be very reliable even if there's no Wi-Fi.

description: The lead designer for ships. They figure out the shape of the hull so the ship stays upright and moves through the water efficiently.

description: Builds AI that can understand human speech and writing. They work on things like Google Translate or Siri, making them smarter at understanding different languages.

description: Designs everything that flies, from small drones and commercial airplanes to rockets and satellites heading to Mars.

description: Studies the earth and rocks at a construction site. They make sure the ground is strong enough to hold a building or bridge without sinking or sliding.

description: Designs dams and underwater turbines that turn the power of moving river water into electricity.

description: Specializes in the design of power substations, which are the hubs where electricity is changed from high voltage to the lower voltage used in homes.

description: Designs tractors, harvesters, and other machines for farming. They focus on making machines that can work in mud and dust while using GPS to plant crops perfectly.

description: Plans the big-picture strategy for how a company trains its employees online. They design the systems and "learning paths" that people follow.

description: Focuses on the machines and chemistry used to make food in huge quantities. They ensure the food is safe, tastes good, and stays fresh for a long time.

description: Runs a store that sells computers and software. They manage the staff and make sure customers get the right advice for their tech needs.

description: Makes parts that are incredibly small or have to be perfect down to a millionth of a meter. They work on high-end optics and medical tools.

description: Manages the network of pipes that bring natural gas to homes for heating and cooking. They focus heavily on safety and preventing leaks.

description: Studies how air flows around objects. They help car and plane designers make shapes that cut through the air easily to save fuel and go faster.

description: Replaces manual factory jobs with robots and smart machines. They program the systems that allow a factory to run itself with very little human help.

description: Works with lasers and light. They design the fiber-optic cables that make the internet fast and the lasers used in surgery.

description: Manages the facilities that pull natural gas out of the earth and clean it so it can be used as fuel.

description: The highly trained mechanics who inspect planes every day. They fix engines and electronics to ensure every flight is 100% safe.

description: Designs systems that use pressurized liquids or air to move heavy things, like the arms on an excavator or the landing gear on a plane.

description: Builds the "virtual" servers that host websites and apps. They make sure the cloud system can handle millions of users without crashing.

description: Creates man-made materials like new types of plastic, rubber, or carbon fiber. They focus on making these materials stronger, lighter, or easier to recycle.

description: Finds ways to make buildings and factories use less power. They might install better insulation, upgrade heaters, or add solar panels to save money and the environment.

description: Protects the "hidden" computers inside things like smart fridges, cars, and pacemakers from being hacked.

description: Manages the radio and satellite systems that allow pilots to talk to air traffic control and send data about the plane's flight path.

description: Focuses on making sure a product doesn't break. They analyze every part to see what might fail and find ways to make the whole system more reliable.

description: Designs the plants that clean up trash and sewage. They focus on recycling as much as possible and making sure any leftover waste is safe for the environment.

description: Designs the complex systems that balance where energy comes from (like wind and coal) and where it goes (to homes and businesses) across a whole region.

description: Researches and develops new ways to power cars and planes, such as using hydrogen or fuel made from plants (biofuels).

description: Specializes in the silicon and chemicals used to make the world’s fastest computer chips.

description: Designs the "nervous system" of a factory—the sensors and gauges that tell the operators exactly what is happening inside the machines.

description: The expert who designs the workplace to prevent accidents. They make sure machines have guards, air is clean to breathe, and workers have the right safety gear.

description: Manages the world’s water. They design the systems that bring clean water to your tap and the pipes that carry rain away during a storm to prevent flooding.

description: Focuses specifically on the engine and transmission of a vehicle. They work to make cars faster while using less gas or electricity.

description: Designs things that use light, like the lenses in your phone camera, the lasers used in eye surgery, or the sensors on a space telescope.
